result.execSummary:
The defendant Conrado Burgos was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Disorderly Conduct [Modifiers: Domestic Abuse, Use of a Dangerous Weapon], a class B misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 947.01(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: Probation Review Hearing scheduled for 08/21/2015 @ 1:30pm, Br-40

miscConds.notes: Pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the DOC's. Any amount remaining due owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means. Cash bail applied.

- No firearms/weapons. Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the No Contact Order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition. Court also advised the defendant that he may qualify to have th DNA sample data expunged if you meet the conditions under Wis. Stats. Section 165.77(4).

- Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.
- Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" and continued programming.
- Participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
- Maintain absolute sobriety other than medication as prescribed.
- Successfully complete an other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
- No Contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the Agent has approved a modification to No Violent Contact.
- Pay all supervision fees as determined by the DOC's.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Conrado Burgos

records.descr: Records of prosec. are converted data. See file.

records.addlTxt: Due to not following the AFTES payment plan agreement, specifically payment(s) were missed, the payment plan has been ended.

Defendant Conrado Burgos in court.  Benjamin Calvin Verhulst appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Probation Agent is in court.  Probation Status Review report filed and reviewed.  Defendant is compliant or mostly compliant with probation.  The remaining condition time is stayed.  Court found that further review is not needed.

Defendant Conrado Burgos in court with attorney Glenn Edward Gaskill.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant was advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties, waived all rights, and plead GUILTY.  Defendant examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Stipulation by parties to complaint as a factual basis to sustain the plea.  Defendant further advised that if he/she is not a US citizen, deportation is possible.  Court found the defendant guilty. Judgment of conviction entered.  Court found the state has satisfied victims' rights law.  Sentencing proceeded.  Statements by the State, defense and defendant.

Defendant sentenced to serve 7 months in the House of Correction with credit for 3 days time served.  COURT STAYED THE SENTENCE and placed the defendant on probation with the State of Wisconsin, Department of Corrections for a period of 18 months.
*
CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-As a condition of probation, the Court ordered the defendant to serve 30 days in the House of Correction.  This time is stayed pending a review on 08/21/2015.
-Mental Health Evaluation and take ALL prescribed medication, and/or any treatment deemed appropriate.        
-Successfully complete "Batterers intervention" and continued programming.
-Defendant to participate in Alcohol and Drug Assessment and successfully complete recommended treatment including random screens.
-Maintain absolute sobriety other than medication as prescribed.
-Successfully complete any other counseling and/or treatment deemed appropriate.
-No contact with victim, UNLESS the victim requests contact, and then only after the agent has approved a modification to no violent contact.
-Defendant to pay all applicable costs and surcharges, victim/witness surcharge, the domestic violence surcharge, and supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.  Any amount remaining due and owing is subject to civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.
-Defendant to pay all supervision fees as determined by the Department of Corrections.
-No firearms; weapons.
Received and filed: Notice of Right to Seek Post-Conviction Relief, Memorandum of Conditions of Probation.  Court advised defendant of penalties for violating the no contact order and due to this DV conviction s/he may never possess firearms or ammunition. Court also advised the defendant that he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if you meet the conditions under Wis. Stats. section 165.77(4).
  Case adjourned to Branch 40.  Probation Review Hearing scheduled for August 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Attorney Fee Trust - Escrow payment plan created 04/27/215 to repay Milwaukee County $50.00 monthly for attorney fees. First payment commencing 06/01/215. O

Defendant Conrado Burgos in court.  Sarra Mae Kiaie appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: rmm.  
Indigency hearing proceeded.  Court makes a finding that defendant is indigent.  Court appoints Glenn Gaskill as counsel for defendant at the rate of $60.00 per hour.  Attorney Gaskill accepts appointment.  Order signed and filed.  Defendant shall reimburse Milwaukee County at the rate of $50.00 per month commencing 6/01/15 until paid in full. Order signed and filed.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment and/or tax intercept or other means.  Case is adjourned to Branch 40.  Court advised defendant that the no contact order remains in effect.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for May 14, 2015 at 08:30 am.

15RM019259  Actual Date Bond Posted with Sheriff:
04/09/2015

The Court ordered defendant to maintain ABSOLUTE SOBRIETY. No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms. Defendant advised it is a requirement to attend all future court proceedings. Failure to comply with conditions of bail may result in an additional charge of bail jumping.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with Kristine L-B.

Defendant Conrado Burgos in court with attorney Nathan Opland-Dobs.  Defendant Conrado Burgos in custody.  Carole Manchester appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
Deputy Court Clerk: tmk.  
Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Dallet, Branch 40.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause.  Defendant advised of right to counsel and complaint given to defendant's attorney.  Defendant plead not guilty.  DEFENDANT IS DOES NOT QUALIFY PUBLIC DEFENDER REPRESENTATION IF RELEASED.  Pre-trial conference scheduled for April 21, 2015 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
